abstracts.cdata!:
The Resettlement Policy Framework (RPF)
            prepared for the Northern Cities Water Supply and Sanitation
            Project explicitly includes the cities covering four major
            cities of the southern Caspian provinces of Gilan and
            Mazandaran: Anzali, Rasht, Babol and Sari. The project seeks
            to enhance environmental and health conditions, and its
            development objectives further include improvement in the
            quality of life, and poverty alleviation; increased coverage
            of sanitation services, and, implementation of a pilot
            program to include hygiene and sanitation practices towards
            improving the health conditions of the targeted population.
            In view of the project's infrastructure development
            works, land acquisition, and the resulting resettlement
            issues will take place; therefore, this resettlement policy
            framework looks at the estimated population to be displaced,
            reviews the country's legislation and the Bank's
            operational directive on involuntary resettlement, and
            provides resettlement guidance and the compensation measures
            to be followed. There are two ways to fund compensation:
            through budgetary provision in the recurrent budget, where
            the water authority (WWC) earns revenue (this is not
            normally the case in this project); or, where the need for
            expropriation has been foreseen in the five-year development
            plan (this is the case with most expropriations in this
            project). Expropriation takes place under Article IX of the
            law of expropriation of Land in the public interest. Based
            on public consultations, and in agreement with project
            affected persons, compensation will be paid in cash at
            market values for loss of land, crops, or physical
            structures, as well as other assets lost. Monitoring
            criteria will be in place to ensure compliance with this
            RAP, as will grievance mechanisms should conflict occur.
